text: It doesn’t seem clear this is possibly, but figured i’d ask. Is there a way to lock the grid so content editors can’t drag a column width. Just wondering since these are custom. Trying to create childproof for content editors lol.

Not currently. We have discussed at some point in the future supporting something like an HTML section. Which would be like a normal template partial you could place inside a dnd_area. It would not have drag and drop within it. So you would be able to basically lock a design down.

That will be a lil ways off before we have that functionality or something similar
Awesome. You’ve been a big help. Thanks!

> Trying to create childproof for content editors
First time I’ve heard it explained with that analogy :laughing:

Hi, I'm working on a site in the drag-n-drop editor for a client.  They'd like a *stock ticker* feature, to show their updated stock value for website visitors.  I couldn't find any modules like that in the free or paid HubSpot marketplace.  BUT I can find many plugins like this in wordpress.   Any ideas on how to proceed?  I'd rather not pay to have a developer code this from scratch as this is a small part of a large site.  But, maybe there is some way to put this in as shortcode or something like an iframe? Thanks!
